description: Documentation for the Workload Details dashboard - detailed panel descriptions with thresholds and color definitions

options.content:
# üìñ Resource Consumption Analysis - Workload Details Documentation

This dashboard provides detailed documentation for each panel in the Workload Details dashboard. Use the navigation links to return to the workload dashboard or the main namespace documentation.

## Pod Count

### Purpose
Shows the current number of running pods for the selected workload.

### Formula
```
count(kube_pod_info{workload})
```

### Color
üîµ **Blue** - Informational metric

### How to Use
- Monitor replica count changes
- Verify expected pod count
- Detect scaling events

## CPU Request (m)

### Purpose
Shows the current CPU request configured in the workload manifest.

### What is CPU Request?
- Guaranteed CPU allocation for the workload
- Used by Kubernetes scheduler for pod placement
- Pod won't be scheduled if nodes can't satisfy requests

### Unit
Millicores (m) - 1000m = 1 CPU core

### Color
üü° **Yellow** - Indicates this is a manifest-configured value

### How to Use
Compare with actual usage to identify over/under-provisioning.

## CPU Limit (m)

### Purpose
Shows the current CPU limit configured in the workload manifest.

### What is CPU Limit?
- Maximum CPU the container can use
- Exceeding causes CPU throttling (not termination)
- Process slows down but continues running

### Unit
Millicores (m) - 1000m = 1 CPU core

### Color
üî¥ **Red** - Indicates this is a limit value (upper bound)

### How to Use
Compare with CPU Max to ensure adequate headroom.

## Mem Request (MiB)

### Purpose
Shows the current memory request configured in the workload manifest.

### What is Memory Request?
- Guaranteed memory allocation for the workload
- Used by Kubernetes scheduler for pod placement
- Affects Quality of Service (QoS) class

### Unit
Mebibytes (MiB)

### Color
üü° **Yellow** - Indicates this is a manifest-configured value

### How to Use
Compare with actual usage to identify over/under-provisioning.

## Mem Limit (MiB)

### Purpose
Shows the current memory limit configured in the workload manifest.

### What is Memory Limit?
- Maximum memory the container can use
- Exceeding causes immediate OOM kill
- Container restarts (if restart policy allows)

### Unit
Mebibytes (MiB)

### Color
üî¥ **Red** - Indicates this is a limit value (OOM kill threshold)

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Critical
Exceeding memory limit causes immediate OOM kill!

## üî• CPU Usage: $workload

### Purpose
Time series visualization showing CPU consumption for the selected workload over time, compared against configured request/limit.

### Lines
| Line | Style | Color | Description |
|------|-------|-------|-------------|
| Usage | Solid | Auto | Actual CPU consumption over time |
| Request | Dashed | üü† Orange | CPU request from manifest - guaranteed allocation |
| Limit | Dashed | üî¥ Red | CPU limit from manifest - maximum before throttling |

### Interpretation
- **Usage below Request**: Under-utilizing allocated resources
- **Usage between Request and Limit**: Using burst capacity (normal for bursty workloads)
- **Usage at/near Limit**: Throttling occurring - consider increasing limit

## üíæ Memory Usage: $workload

### Purpose
Time series visualization showing memory consumption for the selected workload over time, compared against configured request/limit.

### Lines
| Line | Style | Color | Description |
|------|-------|-------|-------------|
| Usage | Solid | Auto | Actual memory working set over time |
| Request | Dashed | üü† Orange | Memory request from manifest - guaranteed allocation |
| Limit | Dashed | üî¥ Red | Memory limit from manifest - OOM kill threshold |

### Interpretation
- **Usage below Request**: Under-utilizing allocated resources
- **Usage between Request and Limit**: Using burst capacity
- **Usage approaching Limit**: ‚ö†Ô∏è OOM kill risk - consider increasing limit immediately
- **Sudden drops to zero**: May indicate OOM kills and container restarts

## CPU % of Request

### Purpose
Gauge showing current CPU usage as a percentage of the configured request.

### Formula
```
(Current CPU Usage / CPU Request) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 50% | üî¥ Red | Over-provisioned |
| 50-110% | üü¢ Green | Optimal utilization |
| > 110% | üü° Yellow | High utilization |

## CPU % of Limit

### Purpose
Gauge showing current CPU usage as a percentage of the configured limit. Indicates throttling risk.

### Formula
```
(Current CPU Usage / CPU Limit) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 70% | üü¢ Green | Safe headroom |
| 70-90% | üü° Yellow | Approaching limit |
| > 90% | üî¥ Red | Throttling likely |

### Note
CPU throttling slows the process but doesn't terminate it.

## Memory % of Request

### Purpose
Gauge showing current memory usage as a percentage of the configured request.

### Formula
```
(Current Memory Usage / Memory Request) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 50% | üî¥ Red | Over-provisioned |
| 50-110% | üü¢ Green | Optimal utilization |
| > 110% | üü° Yellow | High utilization |

## Memory % of Limit

### Purpose
Gauge showing current memory usage as a percentage of the configured limit. Indicates OOM kill risk.

### Formula
```
(Current Memory Usage / Memory Limit) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 70% | üü¢ Green | Safe headroom |
| 70-90% | üü° Yellow | Approaching limit |
| > 90% | üî¥ Red | OOM kill risk |

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Critical
Exceeding memory limit causes immediate OOM kill!

## CPU Limit/Request Ratio

### Purpose
Gauge showing the ratio between CPU limit and CPU request. Indicates how much burst headroom is configured.

### Formula
```
CPU Limit / CPU Request
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 1.2 | üî¥ Red | Insufficient headroom - throttling risk |
| 1.2 - 10 | üü¢ Green | Good balance |
| > 10 | üü° Yellow | Excessive ratio - potential over-provisioning |

### Max Scale
50 (CPU can have higher ratios than memory)

## Memory Limit/Request Ratio

### Purpose
Gauge showing the ratio between memory limit and memory request. Indicates how much burst headroom is configured.

### Formula
```
Memory Limit / Memory Request
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 1.2 | üî¥ Red | Insufficient headroom - OOM risk |
| 1.2 - 3.5 | üü¢ Green | Good balance |
| > 3.5 | üü° Yellow | Excessive ratio - potential over-provisioning |

### Max Scale
10 (Memory should have tighter ratios than CPU)

## üî• CPU with Normal Profile Simulation

### Purpose
Time series comparing actual CPU usage with current and simulated (Normal profile) request/limit values.

### Normal Profile Rules
| Metric | Formula | Description |
|--------|---------|-------------|
| Sim Request | P90 | 90th percentile of CPU usage |
| Sim Limit | P99 √ó 1.5 | 99th percentile √ó 1.5 safety margin |

### Lines
| Line | Style | Color | Description |
|------|-------|-------|-------------|
| Usage | Solid | Auto | Actual CPU usage |
| Sim Request | Short dash | Light orange | Simulated request (P90) |
| Sim Limit | Short dash | Light red | Simulated limit (P99√ó1.5) |

### Note
Current Request/Limit are hidden by default but can be enabled in query editor.

## üíæ Memory with Normal Profile Simulation

### Purpose
Time series comparing actual memory usage with current and simulated (Normal profile) request/limit values.

### Normal Profile Rules
| Metric | Formula | Description |
|--------|---------|-------------|
| Sim Request | P95 | 95th percentile of memory usage |
| Sim Limit | Max √ó 1.2 | Maximum √ó 1.2 safety margin |

### Lines
| Line | Style | Color | Description |
|------|-------|-------|-------------|
| Usage | Solid | Auto | Actual memory usage |
| Sim Request | Short dash | Light orange | Simulated request (P95) |
| Sim Limit | Short dash | Light red | Simulated limit (Max√ó1.2) |

### Note
Current Request/Limit are hidden by default but can be enabled in query editor.

## CPU % of Sim Request (Normal)

### Purpose
Gauge showing current CPU usage as percentage of the **simulated** request (P90).

### Formula
```
(Current CPU / P90) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 50% | üî¥ Red | Over-provisioned for this profile |
| 50-110% | üü¢ Green | Optimal for this profile |
| > 110% | üü° Yellow | High utilization for this profile |

## CPU % of Sim Limit (Normal)

### Purpose
Gauge showing current CPU usage as percentage of the **simulated** limit (P99√ó1.5).

### Formula
```
(Current CPU / (P99 √ó 1.5)) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 70% | üü¢ Green | Safe headroom |
| 70-90% | üü° Yellow | Approaching simulated limit |
| > 90% | üî¥ Red | Would be throttled with this profile |

## Mem % of Sim Request (Normal)

### Purpose
Gauge showing current memory usage as percentage of the **simulated** request (P95).

### Formula
```
(Current Memory / P95) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 50% | üî¥ Red | Over-provisioned for this profile |
| 50-110% | üü¢ Green | Optimal for this profile |
| > 110% | üü° Yellow | High utilization for this profile |

## Mem % of Sim Limit (Normal)

### Purpose
Gauge showing current memory usage as percentage of the **simulated** limit (Max√ó1.2).

### Formula
```
(Current Memory / (Max √ó 1.2)) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 70% | üü¢ Green | Safe headroom |
| 70-90% | üü° Yellow | Approaching simulated limit |
| > 90% | üî¥ Red | OOM risk with this profile |

## CPU Sim Limit/Request (Normal)

### Purpose
Gauge showing the ratio between simulated CPU limit (P99√ó1.5) and request (P90) for the Normal profile.

### Formula
```
(P99 √ó 1.5) / P90
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 1.2 | üî¥ Red | Insufficient headroom in simulation |
| 1.2 - 10 | üü¢ Green | Good balance |
| > 10 | üü° Yellow | Wide gap between P90 and P99 |

## Mem Sim Limit/Request (Normal)

### Purpose
Gauge showing the ratio between simulated memory limit (Max√ó1.2) and request (P95) for the Normal profile.

### Formula
```
(Max √ó 1.2) / P95
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 1.2 | üî¥ Red | Insufficient headroom in simulation |
| 1.2 - 3.5 | üü¢ Green | Good balance |
| > 3.5 | üü° Yellow | Wide gap between P95 and Max |

## üî• CPU with Aggressive Profile Simulation

### Purpose
Time series comparing actual CPU usage with current and simulated (Aggressive profile) request/limit values.

### Aggressive Profile Rules
| Metric | Formula | Description |
|--------|---------|-------------|
| Sim Request | P95 √ó 1.1 | 95th percentile √ó 1.1 |
| Sim Limit | Max √ó 1.25 | Maximum √ó 1.25 minimal safety margin |

### Lines
| Line | Style | Color | Description |
|------|-------|-------|-------------|
| Usage | Solid | Auto | Actual CPU usage |
| Sim Request | Short dash | Light orange | Simulated request (P95√ó1.1) |
| Sim Limit | Short dash | Light red | Simulated limit (Max√ó1.25) |

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning
Aggressive profile has tighter margins - higher throttling risk!

## üíæ Memory with Aggressive Profile Simulation

### Purpose
Time series comparing actual memory usage with current and simulated (Aggressive profile) request/limit values.

### Aggressive Profile Rules
| Metric | Formula | Description |
|--------|---------|-------------|
| Sim Request | Max | Maximum memory usage (no buffer) |
| Sim Limit | Max √ó 1.25 | Maximum √ó 1.25 minimal safety margin |

### Lines
| Line | Style | Color | Description |
|------|-------|-------|-------------|
| Usage | Solid | Auto | Actual memory usage |
| Sim Request | Short dash | Light orange | Simulated request (Max) |
| Sim Limit | Short dash | Light red | Simulated limit (Max√ó1.25) |

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning
Aggressive profile has tighter margins - higher OOM kill risk!

## CPU % of Sim Request (Aggressive)

### Purpose
Gauge showing current CPU usage as percentage of the **simulated** request (P95√ó1.1).

### Formula
```
(Current CPU / (P95 √ó 1.1)) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 50% | üî¥ Red | Over-provisioned for this profile |
| 50-110% | üü¢ Green | Optimal for this profile |
| > 110% | üü° Yellow | High utilization for this profile |

## CPU % of Sim Limit (Aggressive)

### Purpose
Gauge showing current CPU usage as percentage of the **simulated** limit (Max√ó1.25).

### Formula
```
(Current CPU / (Max √ó 1.25)) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 70% | üü¢ Green | Safe headroom |
| 70-90% | üü° Yellow | Approaching simulated limit |
| > 90% | üî¥ Red | Would be throttled with this profile |

## Mem % of Sim Request (Aggressive)

### Purpose
Gauge showing current memory usage as percentage of the **simulated** request (Max).

### Formula
```
(Current Memory / Max) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 50% | üî¥ Red | Over-provisioned for this profile |
| 50-110% | üü¢ Green | Optimal for this profile |
| > 110% | üü° Yellow | High utilization for this profile |

## Mem % of Sim Limit (Aggressive)

### Purpose
Gauge showing current memory usage as percentage of the **simulated** limit (Max√ó1.25).

### Formula
```
(Current Memory / (Max √ó 1.25)) √ó 100
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 70% | üü¢ Green | Safe headroom |
| 70-90% | üü° Yellow | Approaching simulated limit |
| > 90% | üî¥ Red | OOM risk with this profile |

## CPU Sim Limit/Request (Aggressive)

### Purpose
Gauge showing the ratio between simulated CPU limit (Max√ó1.25) and request (P95√ó1.1) for the Aggressive profile.

### Formula
```
(Max √ó 1.25) / (P95 √ó 1.1)
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 1.2 | üî¥ Red | Insufficient headroom in simulation |
| 1.2 - 10 | üü¢ Green | Good balance |
| > 10 | üü° Yellow | Wide gap between P95 and Max |

## Mem Sim Limit/Request (Aggressive)

### Purpose
Gauge showing the ratio between simulated memory limit (Max√ó1.25) and request (Max) for the Aggressive profile.

### Formula
```
(Max √ó 1.25) / Max = 1.25 (constant)
```

### Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation |
|-------|-------|----------------|
| < 1.2 | üî¥ Red | Insufficient headroom |
| 1.2 - 3.5 | üü¢ Green | Good balance |
| > 3.5 | üü° Yellow | Over-provisioned |

### Note
This ratio is always 1.25 for Aggressive profile (Max√ó1.25 / Max).

## CPU Usage per Pod

### Purpose
Time series showing CPU consumption broken down by individual pod for the selected workload.

### Use Cases
- **Load Distribution**: Identify if load is evenly distributed across replicas
- **Anomaly Detection**: Spot individual pods with unusual behavior
- **Startup/Shutdown**: Visualize pod lifecycle patterns
- **Troubleshooting**: Isolate problematic pods

### Legend Statistics
- **mean**: Average CPU for each pod
- **max**: Maximum CPU for each pod

### What to Look For
- **Even lines**: Good load balancing
- **One pod higher than others**: Possible hot-spotting
- **Spikes in individual pods**: Application-level issues
- **Gaps in lines**: Pod restarts or replacements

## Memory Usage per Pod

### Purpose
Time series showing memory consumption broken down by individual pod for the selected workload.

### Use Cases
- **Memory Leaks**: Identify pods with continuously growing memory
- **Uneven Distribution**: Spot pods with different memory profiles
- **Startup/Shutdown**: Visualize pod lifecycle and memory behavior
- **OOM Investigation**: Correlate memory growth with OOM events

### Legend Statistics
- **mean**: Average memory for each pod
- **max**: Maximum memory for each pod

### What to Look For
- **Steady lines**: Healthy, stable memory usage
- **Upward trend**: Possible memory leak
- **Sawtooth pattern**: GC pressure or memory recycling
- **Sudden drops**: OOM kills and restarts

title: Resource Consumption Analysis - Workload Details Documentation
